content: Sculpture in Singapore ***All the Essentially Essential*** is a sculpture in [Raffles Place Park](/wiki/Raffles_Place_Park), Singapore. ## History The sculpture won the CDL Singapore Sculpture Award in 2007 and its proposed design was temporarily displayed at the [Singapore Art Museum](/wiki/Singapore_Art_Museum) from 21 to 26 September. The sculpture was moved to [Raffles Place Park](/wiki/Raffles_Place_Park) in 2013. ## Details The sculpture was sculpted with [stainless steel](/wiki/Stainless_steel) by Tan Wee Lit. The sculpture is of a toy kit, featuring several items, including a briefcase, a stroller and a bicycle, and is meant to represent the "work-life balance that Singaporeans strive for". The sculpture is intentionally left incomplete, to represent that "people's vitality and aspirations are the most essential factors that make life complete". ## Gallery This article about a Singapore building or structure is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: All the Essentially Essential
